title: Hi, and welcome!
text:
I’m Rebecca Martinez — a student researcher and environmental studies major based in California.
This site highlights the projects I’m working on, the experiences shaping my academic path, and the ways I stay involved beyond the classroom. Whether you’re here to browse, collaborate, or just learn more, I’m glad you stopped by!
Note: Some sections are still in progress as I add new content. Thanks for your patience!

title: Rebecca Martinez
text:
Email
  
  
    
     
  

      
Hi! I’m Rebecca — a mom of two, Environmental Studies major at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB), and Marine Corps veteran. I’ve taken an unconventional path to college, but I’ve made every step count. I’m drawn to work that’s hands-on, community-centered, and rooted in care — whether that’s in the field, the classroom, or beyond.
Right now, I’m focused on environmental research, mentorship, and exploring how undergraduate education can connect science, service, and real-world impact.

title: Rebecca Martinez
text:
🛤️ My Path
Before returning to school, I spent two decades working, raising two incredible kids, and navigating life’s many responsibilities — including time in the Marine Corps Reserves and nearly two decades in a civilian job. I started my academic journey at community college, where I reconnected with my love for science and service. Now, as an Environmental Studies major at UCSB, I’m combining research, search, and community engagement into a path that feels both meaningful and practical.
photo photo

title: About Rebecca
text:
Life Beyond the Books
When I’m not in class or out collecting data, you’ll probably find me outdoors, at a local event, or hanging out with my two cats — Chester and Leo. I like building things, learning new tools, and being part of projects that make a difference. I’m also a fan of spontaneous road trips, science memes, and really good coffee.



Chester and Leo

title: Rebecca Martinez
text:
❤️ Things I Care About
I’m passionate about science that serves the community. From organizing donation drives with AGS at Hancock College to launching outreach for women veterans in Santa Barbara, I believe the best work is rooted in care and collaboration.
 

Thanks for visiting! You can explore my projects and photos pages to see what I’ve been up to.

title: Rebecca Martinez
text:
👩‍👧‍👦😺 Family & Life
I’m a proud mom to two incredible teenagers. They’ve grown up alongside my journey, and honestly, they’re my biggest motivation. Outside of school, I love volunteering, spending time in nature, and hanging out with my cats, Chester and Leo.
kids cats
Curious about Chester and Leo? You can find more fluffiness here.

title: About Rebecca
text:
Fieldwork Favorites



Some of my most memorable experiences have been in the field — at places like Santa Cruz Island Reserve, Sedgwick Reserve, Rancho Marino, and even Panama. I love combining science, nature, and hands-on learning. These moments keep me grounded and curious.



Thanks for stopping by! Feel free to explore the other pages to learn more about my projects and see more photos!

title: About Rebecca
text:
Fieldwork & Research



Some of my most memorable experiences have come through hands-on work — from the [Santa Cruz Island Reserve](projects.qmd) to Sedgwick and Rancho Marino, and even Panama. I enjoy connecting academic research with real-world ecosystems, and these projects help me stay grounded, curious, and engaged.



Thanks for stopping by! Feel free to explore the other pages to learn more about my projects and see more photos!

title: Rebecca Martinez
text:
🌿 Fieldwork Adventures
I’m happiest when I’m outside, learning by doing. Hands-on environmental work helps me connect what I’m learning in the classroom to real ecosystems and real people. I believe fieldwork is one of the most powerful ways to teach and inspire others — especially students and community members who may not see themselves in science yet.
field field
You can explore my projects and photos pages to see what I’ve been up to.

title: Rebecca Martinez
text:
❤️ Work That Matters
Community involvement has always been a meaningful part of my life. Whether it’s through mentoring, volunteering, or helping behind the scenes, I try to contribute where I can — not because I have all the answers, but because I believe in being part of something that gives back. Over the years, I’ve stayed involved with efforts that reflect those values, like Toys for Tots, campus and local outreach, and She Raised Her Hand.
To me, meaningful work is about showing up — and trusting that what we offer contributes to something bigger than ourselves.
photo photo
Please visit She Raised Her Hand for more information and upcoming events.
If you’d like to support seasonal giving efforts, donations can be made through Toys for Tots.
